phases.text: Welcome. Think of the ocean not as pieces with names, but as one moving body—currents linking every shore. I’ll guide you and offer hints when needed.
Question one. Which description fits best—separate oceans that don’t affect each other, or one global ocean connected by currents? Choose when you're ready.
Question two. What mainly drives the ocean’s great conveyors—only tides from the Moon, or wind with temperature and salt (density) differences? Choose when you're ready.
Question three. Why do healthy oceans matter to you and me—is it mainly about fish and beaches, or about oxygen, climate balance, food, and livelihoods? Choose when you're ready.
Wisdom to carry: care for the ocean and it cares for you—each breath, each meal, each calm day. Do one small protective act today.
